headline: Tariffs slam retailers as Walmart and Nike see declines
summary: Retail stocks are taking a hit in after-hours trading, with Walmart (WMT) and Amazon (AMZN) seeing significant drops. Yahoo Finance Executive Editor Brian Sozzi joins Asking for a Trend host Josh Lipton to explain how tariffs on imports from China and the European Union could hurt retailers like Walmart, Amazon, and Nike (NKE). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here.

headline: Apple Stock and Other Tech Favorites Drop
summary: Shares in some of the biggest U.S. technology and consumer firms fell late Wednesday following President Trump's announcement of significant tariffs, including 34% on China and 46% on Vietnam, nations that export large amounts of goods to America.

raw.headline: Apple Stock and Other Tech Favorites Drop

headline: Why Nike Stock Tumbled 20% in March
summary: Things went from bad to worse for Nike (NYSE: NKE) last month as the struggling sportswear giant posted disappointing results in its fiscal third-quarter earnings report and warned that its performance would get even worse in the fourth quarter.  The blue chip stock fell to a seven-year low as it continues to lose market share to faster-growing upstart brands like Deckers' HOKA and On Holdings and investors grow impatient with the turnaround strategy under new CEO Elliott Hill.  Nike actually beat analyst estimates in the quarter, but that was little consolation to investors amid the declines in revenue and profit, and its guidance also called for its performance to get worse in the fourth quarter.
